NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
Office of the President
Station KUOM
University of Minnesota
Minneapolis II4., Minnesota
November 13, 1957
Dr* John C. Schwarzwalder
General Manager
KTCA-TV
Building TSA - Room 110
University of Minnesota
St. Paul 1, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Schwarzwalder:
I have received my carbon copy of your letter of November
6th to Dick Vogl, director of NAEB’ s Region ]±, in which you
state that, unless "the present reactionary tendencies in
NAEB leadership can be reversed promptly,” KTCA will not renew
its membership. Since the Issues you raise are important
to the whole educational broadcasting movement, as well as
NAEB as such, I shall send your letter to our Board of
Directors. What follows is my own reaction, however, since
the Board has not yet seen your letter.
I appreciate your acceptance of Dick Vogl's invitation
to write out your reactions to certain actions taken by the
NAEB Board of Directors at the St. Louis convention, but
nevertheless I do not think your main points are well taken.
In fact, this letter Is like some other communications of
yours which recently have come to my attention. It reveals
your sense for the dramatic and your skill In writing; it is
more emotional than logical; and It is the sort of letter
which, after second thought, I should think you would. In
part at least, want to withdraw. Most important of all,
however, it shows an incorrect perception and Interpretation
of the facts.
Your major point (Items 1 and 2) is an expression of
dissatisfaction with the Board of Directors for not immediately
accepting the recommendations of the Television Operations and
Development Committee in regard to activating new television
stations, and In connection with educational television stations
raising money nationally.
The official action taken by the Board of Directors appears
in the preliminary Minutes as follows: ”Both Schwarzwalder
proposals as reported in detail to the Board by the Television
Operations and Development Committee were discussed at length.
